hypothesis_content.title: DeFi Altcoin Volatility Compression Breakout Post-BTC Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC consolidates in a tight range (<3% daily range) for 3 consecutive days in a NEUTRAL regime, a subsequent BTC breakout above the consolidation high will trigger a larger percentage move in mid-cap DeFi alts (SOL, AVAX, CRV) relative to BTC over the next 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During neutral regimes, capital rotates between assets. BTC consolidation suggests indecision; a resolution upward often signals renewed risk appetite, causing leveraged flows into higher-beta DeFi assets as traders chase performance. The tight range indicates built-up pressure.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above the high of the 3-day consolidation range
Enter long SOL/USDT, AVAX/USDT, and CRV/USDT simultaneously on breakout confirmation (close above high)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close positions when the average return of the 3 alts reaches 2x the percentage move of BTC from breakout point, or after 48 hours, whichever comes first.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: If BTC price falls back below the midpoint of the prior consolidation range, exit all positions.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average return of the 3 DeFi alts fails to exceed 1.2x the BTC move over the 48-hour window following a valid breakout signal on more than 55% of historical occurrences.
